instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> small liquid damage
threads.message:
literally a drop on <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR>, cleaned was powering fans on and USB, USB would turn off after maybe 7 seconds and no activity
assumed <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR> shorted dead and no CPU (should have measured)
so I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR> (donor <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board), still same behavior
i then tried <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>
now no fan and usb flashes real quick off

did I fry it and make it worse?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> small liquid damage
threads.message: You fucked up something. But with liquid in that location a dead CPU is very likely. Redo what you did and see if it goes back to the original state of 7 seconds on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> small liquid damage
threads.message:
when i put <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> back i get the old behavior, fan+usb turning on and off at least 2 times (is that normal like the 2013+ airs?)
it seems the chip is a little smaller than on the 4924 boards, maybe not fitting right?
looks like some liquid and corrosion did get under <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> but only on the pin5 side

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> small liquid damage
threads.message: No 3476 will not on/off. Dead CPU is probably the issue here. Is pin 8 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> looking good?
